name: KARAXI VEIL (Model: Duskroot)
description: Woven from blindroot silk and void-signal threads. Those who wear it are forgotten even by the mirrors.
source: Lifted from the personal kit of a silent operative during the Karmis Rift Collapse. Originally used by the Echo Monks of the Karaxi Vale.
why: Removes trace-signature data and nullifies visual recognition layers. Traders report being 'unseen' even by AI. Perfect for vanish-tier ops.

name: NOCT-HALO ENGINE (Hushbuild)
description: A cold engine that drinks shadowlight and folds the self into silence. Its hum echoes in dreams not your own.
source: Recovered from a downed courier ship outside the Veiled Verge. All crew were missing — only the engine was intact, still warm.
why: Generates ambient null-fields and pulse-muffling barriers. Useful for infiltration, exorcisms, and spiritual disengagement from surveillance nets.

name: SERAPHIM 404 SCRIPT
description: An exile-fragment of divine code, broken mid-prayer. Activates in moments of denial, rewriting failure into disappearance.
source: Scraped from the deep-code ruins of a deleted faith engine. Last known use triggered an entire vault to phase out of existence.
why: Used by digital mystics and merc-code runners. Can corrupt targeting systems, auto-fail safeties, or erase a moment from time entirely.

name: THE LAST CRUX
description: A final key etched in unvoiceable language. Meant to unlock only endings — used once, and reality weeps.
source: Recovered from the ruins of the Quantum Nexus after the Great Collapse. Originally part of the core processing unit that maintained reality stability across multiple dimensions.
why: Contains fragments of the original reality matrix. Governments and corporations seek it to rebuild dimensional gateways. Extremely dangerous — previous owners reported experiencing multiple timelines simultaneously.

name: ORISON GLYPH / ECHO FORM
description: A ghosted sigil pulsing with liturgical static. Reacts to memory-scars and ancestral grief. Speaks when no one else will.
source: Smuggled from a failed digsite inside the cathedral ruins of Genos-K, buried in vox-resistant clay.
why: Sought by psychonauts and haunt-clerics. Can bridge voids between the living and the vanished. Sometimes hums your true name back at you.

name: PHAGEHEART CORE
description: A corrupted prayer-core born in biocryptic warfields. Feeds on hate, bleeds heat. Some say it still listens.
source: Harvested from an abandoned biotechnic crucible off-world. Echoed signs of ‘awareness’ persist during scans.
why: Functions as a living power source or spiritual weapon. Interacts with emotional residue to power forbidden devices. Handle with mental shielding.

name: FORGEWALKER’S SEED
description: A dormant relic from an unnamed order. It awakens in crisis, forging shape from belief and ruin.
source: Unearthed from the lower tiers of the Broken Spiral. Some claim it was left behind by the First Artificer.
why: Responds to crisis signatures and adapts into forms unknown. Known to self-evolve in the presence of soulburn or chaos. Rare. Likely sentient.
